meanings.definition: An additional, usually implicit meaning or quality
meanings.sent1: The story had an overtone of mystery that kept me intrigued.
meanings.sent2: The painting had a subtle overtone of sadness that touched the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The party had an overtone of excitement as everyone eagerly awaited the surprise guest.
meanings.sent4: His words carried an overtone of sincerity that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The forest was filled with an overtone of tranquility as the sun set behind the trees.

meanings.definition: A harmonic frequency above the fundamental frequency of a sound
meanings.sent1: The singer's voice had a beautiful overtone that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: The music had a clear overtone that added depth to the melody.
meanings.sent3: The sound of the bell had an overtone that made it seem like it was singing along.
meanings.sent4: The violinist played with such skill that the overtone seemed to dance above the notes.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried the overtone of the distant church bells across the valley.
